event.name: ICA Deep Dives: Demystifying Data with Catherine D’Ignazio
event.shortDescription: Learn strategies for finding and analyzing data that matters to you.

description.html:
Data about us is being gathered constantly, and we are surrounded by data visualizations. Catherine D’Ignazio, assistant professor of journalism at Emerson College and 2008 James and Audrey Foster Prize artist, discusses the responsibilities of journalists, policymakers, artists, data scientists, and citizens in making sense of data, telling evidence-based stories, and ensuring that data collection and analysis address community needs. Learn strategies for finding and analyzing data that matters to you.

ICA Deep Dives is a new series designed to present knowledge on a subject related to a current exhibition. These crash courses by local experts include interactive elements in which participants can apply their new know-how.
